com.almis.alu.batch.services.manager

Class BatchManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • AWEManager
      • com.almis.alu.batch.services.manager.BatchManager

  • public class BatchManager
extends AWEManager

    BatchManager Class

    Provides asyncronous batch launch methods

    Author:
    Pablo GARCIA - 05/JUL/2010

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      BatchManager()
      Access manager constructor

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ServiceData createProcess(java.lang.String Bat, java.lang.String PrcParNam)
      Create a batch process This method gets a new key for a batch process and inserts the batch-process relation in the table.

      Launches a list of ALU batches This method will try use the user in session and default for process identifier

      ServiceData launchSingle(java.util.Date batchDate, java.lang.String batchName)
      Launches an ALU batch This method will use the default values for user and process identifier
      ServiceData launchSingle(java.lang.String user, java.util.Date batchDate, java.util.Date endDate, java.lang.String batPrc, java.lang.String batchName)
      Launches an ALU batch with a user and with attached process With the attached process batch will check for the dynamic arguments related to the process to use them instead of the ones defined in the task-argument definition.
      ServiceData launchSingle(java.lang.String user, java.util.Date batchDate, java.lang.String batPrc, java.lang.String batchName) 
      ServiceData launchSingleWithCommand(java.util.Date batchDate, java.lang.String batchName, java.lang.String Tsk, java.lang.String PrevCommand, java.lang.String Usr)
      Launches an ALU batch wtih a previous command This method will use the default values for user and process identifier

      • launchSingle

        public ServiceData launchSingle(java.lang.String user,
                       java.util.Date batchDate,
                       java.util.Date endDate,
                       java.lang.String batPrc,
                       java.lang.String batchName)
                         throws AWException
        Launches an ALU batch with a user and with attached process With the attached process batch will check for the dynamic arguments related to the process to use them instead of the ones defined in the task-argument definition.
        Parameters:
        user - User for launching batch
        batchDate - Batch date
        endDate - End date
        batPrc - Batch process identifier
        batchName - Batch name
        Returns:
        Service Data
        Throws:
        AWException

      • createProcess

        public ServiceData createProcess(java.lang.String Bat,
                        java.lang.String PrcParNam)
                          throws AWException
        Create a batch process This method gets a new key for a batch process and inserts the batch-process relation in the table. The new generated key is saved as integer in the variable defined in the "PrcParNam" parameter. To save the new process in database it calls to "aluBatInsPrc" maintain.
        Parameters:
        Bat - Batch name
        PrcParNam - Name of parameter in which save the generated process identifier
        Returns:
        Service data
        Throws:
        AWException

      • insertArgument

        public ServiceData insertArgument(java.lang.String Bat,
                         java.lang.String Prc,
                         java.lang.String TskNam,
                         java.lang.String ArgNam,
                         java.lang.String ArgVal)
                           throws AWException
        Insert argument value for a batch process This method inserts a value for an argument of a task for a batch process
        Parameters:
        Bat - Batch name
        Prc - Process identifier
        TskNam - Name of the task
        ArgNam - Name of the argument
        ArgVal - Argument value
        Returns:
        Service data
        Throws:
        AWException
